FuncDef:
The set dscp command configures a DSCP value for IPv4 packets..
The undo set dscp command restores the default DSCP value of IPv4 packets.
By default, the DSCP value of IPv4 packets is 0.
CLIs: set dscp { <dscp-value> | af11 | af12 | af13 | af21 | af22 | af23 | af31 | af32 | af33 | af41 | af42 | af43 | cs1 | cs2 | cs3 | cs4 | cs5 | cs6 | cs7 | default | ef } { inbound | outbound }

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates the DSCP value of IPv4 packets.
The value is an integer ranges from 0 to 63.

Indicates the DSCP value of IPv4 packets is af11.
-

-

Indicates the packets to be decrypted.
-

Indicates the packets to be encrypted.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After an IPSec packet is encrypted, a new IP header is generated. The set dscp command is used to configure a DSCP value for the new IP header.
Precautions
If the set dscp command is used several times in the same IPSec policy view, only the last configuration takes effect.
